ancestries.name: Android
ancestries.description: Androids are semi-organic beings created by advanced technology. The example here mimics humans in most ways and can generally pass for them when desired (and not examined by a physician).

abilities.name: Pacifist (Major)
abilities.description: Unless the android is designed for combat, most advanced societies require the installation of 'Asimov Circuits.' The artificial being may not injure a sapient being, or through action or inaction, allow such a being to be harmed.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Pacifist Major Hindrance

abilities.name: Construct
abilities.description: Androids add +2 to recover from being Shaken, don't breathe, ignore one level of Wound modifiers, and are immune to poison and disease. Constructs cannot heal naturally. Healing one requires the Repair skill.
abilities.mechanical_effect: +2 to recover from Shaken; immune to poison/disease; ignore 1 Wound penalty; heal with Repair skill

abilities.name: Outsider (Major)
abilities.description: Androids subtract 2 from Persuasion rolls when interacting with anyone besides other androids, and have no legal rights in most areas (they're generally considered property).
abilities.mechanical_effect: -2 Persuasion with non-androids; no legal rights

abilities.name: Vow (Major)
abilities.description: Constructs are designed with a particular purpose. Player character constructs have broad directives such as serving a particular corporation or political faction.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Major Vow to specific directive/purpose

ancestries.name: Aquarian
ancestries.description: From the crushing ocean depths come aquatic folk. They are thick and sturdy beneath the waves but often vulnerable in the dry air or searing heat of the surface.

abilities.name: Aquatic
abilities.description: Aquarians cannot drown in water and move at their full Pace when swimming.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Cannot drown; full Pace swimming

abilities.name: Dependency
abilities.description: Aquarians must immerse themselves in water one hour out of every 24 or become automatically Fatigued each day until they are Incapacitated. The day after Incapacitation from dehydration, they perish.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Must immerse in water 1 hour per 24 hours or gain Fatigue

abilities.name: Low Light Vision
abilities.description: Aquarians are used to the darkness of the depths. They ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Ignore Dim and Dark Illumination penalties

abilities.name: Toughness
abilities.description: Life in the depths of their watery worlds has made aquarian flesh tough and resilient. Add +1 to their Toughness.
abilities.mechanical_effect: +1 Toughness

ancestries.name: Avion
ancestries.description: Avions are humanoids with wings. They tend to be very slight of build owing to their hollow bones. Some are feathered while others are leathery or even scaled.

abilities.name: Can't Swim
abilities.description: Avions' wings are a hazard in water. They subtract 2 from Athletics (swimming) rolls and each inch moved in water costs them 3″ of Pace.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -2 Athletics (swimming); 3″ Pace cost per inch in water

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.description: Avions fly at Pace 12 per round. Use Athletics when maneuvering.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Fly at Pace 12; use Athletics for maneuvering

abilities.name: Frail
abilities.description: Avions have −1 Toughness due to their hollow bones.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -1 Toughness

abilities.name: Keen Senses
abilities.description: Avions are more perceptive than most. They begin with a d6 in Notice (instead of d4) and may raise the skill to d12 + 1.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Start with Notice d6; max Notice d12+1

abilities.name: Reduced Pace
abilities.description: Dependence on flight and bulky wings make avions slightly slower when walking. Decrease their walking Pace by 1 and their running die by one step.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -1 Pace; running die reduced one step

ancestries.name: Celestial
ancestries.description: Angels are a great and varied lot, but all have these traits in common. (Custom ancestry example from the Core Rules)

abilities.name: All Thumbs
abilities.description: Celestials are not accustomed to technology or machines.
abilities.mechanical_effect: All Thumbs Hindrance (-2 to mechanical/electrical devices)

abilities.name: Arcane Background (Miracles)
abilities.description: Celestials can call forth a variety of blessed miracles.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Arcane Background (Miracles) Edge

abilities.name: Faith
abilities.description: All celestials start with a d6 in Faith. This increases their maximum to d12 + 1.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Start with Faith d6; max Faith d12+1

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.description: Angels fly at Pace 12.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Fly at Pace 12

abilities.name: Ancestral Enemy (Demons & Devils)
abilities.description: Those who descend from above do not easily tolerate those who crawl forth from the Abyss.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -2 Persuasion with demons/devils

abilities.name: Vow (Major—Protect humanity)
abilities.description: The blessed must protect the flock that remains on the ravaged Earth.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Major Vow to protect humanity

ancestries.name: Dwarf
ancestries.description: Dwarves are short but stout, hardy people who come from massive caverns or high mountains. They are a proud, warlike people, usually made so by frequent contact with hostile creatures such as orcs and goblins.

abilities.name: Low Light Vision
abilities.description: Dwarven eyes are accustomed to the dark of the underearth. They ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Ignore Dim and Dark Illumination penalties

abilities.name: Reduced Pace
abilities.description: Dwarves have short legs compared to most. Decrease their Pace by 1 and their running die one die type.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -1 Pace; running die reduced one step

abilities.name: Tough
abilities.description: Dwarves are stout and tough. They start with a d6 Vigor instead of a d4. This increases maximum Vigor to d12 + 1.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Start with Vigor d6; max Vigor d12+1

ancestries.name: Elf
ancestries.description: Elves are tall, thin souls with pointed ears and deep-set eyes of various colors. Whether they hail from the deep forests or hidden valleys, they are all born more graceful than humans, though somewhat slighter.

abilities.name: Agile
abilities.description: Elves are graceful and agile. They start with a d6 in Agility instead of a d4. This increases maximum Agility to d12 + 1.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Start with Agility d6; max Agility d12+1

abilities.name: All Thumbs
abilities.description: Elves have an inherent dislike of mechanical objects, and thus have the All Thumbs Hindrance. They shun most mechanical items and designs.
abilities.mechanical_effect: All Thumbs Hindrance (-2 to mechanical/electrical devices)

abilities.name: Low Light Vision
abilities.description: Elven eyes amplify light. Others often claim they can see stars in the elves' eyes. They ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Ignore Dim and Dark Illumination penalties

ancestries.name: Guardian
ancestries.description: Those humans who serve the Heavenly Choir are called guardians. (Custom ancestry example from the Core Rules)

abilities.name: Adaptable
abilities.description: Guardians begin play with any Novice Edge of their choosing (meeting its Requirements as usual).
abilities.mechanical_effect: Free Novice Edge (must meet requirements)

abilities.name: Champions
abilities.description: Guardians have the Champion Edge, giving them a +2 bonus to damage against supernaturally evil foes such as demons and devils.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Champion Edge (+2 damage vs supernatural evil)

abilities.name: Vigorous
abilities.description: Those humans who have inherited this blasted Earth start the game with a d6 Vigor instead of a d4. This increases their Vigor maximum to d12 + 1.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Start with Vigor d6; max Vigor d12+1

abilities.name: Vow (Major—Protect humanity)
abilities.description: The blessed must protect the remaining flock on Earth.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Major Vow to protect humanity

ancestries.name: Half-Elf
ancestries.description: Half-elves gain the elves' grace but none of their elegant frailty. Most are well-adjusted, but some are shunned by one side of the family or the other and grow resentful.

abilities.name: Heritage
abilities.description: Half-elves may retain the grace of their elven parent or the adaptability of their human ancestry. A half-elf may either start with a free Novice Edge of his choice or a d6 in Agility instead of a d4 (which also increases his Agility maximum to d12 + 1).
abilities.mechanical_effect: Choose: Free Novice Edge OR Agility d6 (max d12+1)

abilities.name: Low Light Vision
abilities.description: Half-elves ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Ignore Dim and Dark Illumination penalties

abilities.name: Outsider (Minor)
abilities.description: Half-elves are never quite comfortable in human or elven society, having a foot in both worlds but never fully standing in either. They subtract 2 from Persuasion rolls with all but others of their kind.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -2 Persuasion with all but other half-elves

ancestries.name: Half-Folk
ancestries.description: Half-folk are small, nimble people with fuzzy brown or black hair. Though they are frail compared to most other species, their cheerful optimism (or wily cunning) gives them a 'never say die' attitude.

abilities.name: Luck
abilities.description: Half-folk draw one additional Benny per game session.
abilities.mechanical_effect: +1 Benny per session

abilities.name: Reduced Pace
abilities.description: Decrease the character's Pace by 1 and their running die one die type.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -1 Pace; running die reduced one step

abilities.name: Size −1
abilities.description: Half-folk average only about four feet tall, reducing their Size (and therefore Toughness) by 1.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Size -1 (Toughness -1)

abilities.name: Spirited
abilities.description: Half-folk are generally optimistic beings. They start with a d6 Spirit instead of a d4. This increases their maximum Spirit to d12 + 1.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Start with Spirit d6; max Spirit d12+1

ancestries.name: Human
ancestries.description: Humans in most settings get one free Edge of their choice. This option reflects their versatility and adaptability compared to most other ancestries.

abilities.name: Adaptable
abilities.description: Humans begin play with any Novice Edge of their choosing. They must meet its Requirements as usual.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Free Novice Edge (must meet requirements)

ancestries.name: Rakashan
ancestries.description: Rakashans are humanoid felines. Some have the bright colors of tigers, the speckled hides of leopards, or the exotic look of Siamese cats. All have sharp claws and teeth, and a cruel nature when it comes to dealing with their prey.

abilities.name: Agile
abilities.description: Feline grace gives rakashans a d6 Agility attribute instead of a d4. This increases maximum Agility to d12 + 1.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Start with Agility d6; max Agility d12+1

abilities.name: Bite/Claws
abilities.description: Rakashan fangs and claws are Natural Weapons that cause Strength+d4 damage.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Natural Weapons: Str+d4 damage

abilities.name: Bloodthirsty
abilities.description: Rakashans can be cruel to their foes, often toying with them for simple amusement. They rarely take prisoners and feel little compunction about punishing captured foes.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Bloodthirsty Major Hindrance

abilities.name: Can't Swim
abilities.description: Rakashans actually can swim, they just shun it and are not particularly good at it. They subtract 2 from Athletics (swimming) rolls and each tabletop inch of movement in water uses 3″ of Pace.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -2 Athletics (swimming); 3″ Pace cost per inch in water

abilities.name: Low Light Vision
abilities.description: Rakashan eyes amplify light. They ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Ignore Dim and Dark Illumination penalties

abilities.name: Ancestral Enemy
abilities.description: Rakashan society rose at the expense of another. Pick a common ancestry in your setting. Members of each culture subtract 2 from Persuasion when dealing with each other and often attack on sight.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Choose enemy ancestry; -2 Persuasion with them

ancestries.name: Saurian
ancestries.description: Lizard men typically come from steaming jungles or deep deserts where they have unique civilizations unknown to other sentient beings.

abilities.name: Armor +2
abilities.description: Saurians have scaly skin that acts as leather armor.
abilities.mechanical_effect: +2 Armor

abilities.name: Bite
abilities.description: A saurian's fangs are Natural Weapons that cause Strength+d4 damage.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Natural Weapons: Str+d4 damage

abilities.name: Environmental Weakness
abilities.description: Though not truly cold-blooded, saurians are poorly suited for frigid conditions. They suffer a −4 penalty to resist cold environmental effects, and suffer +4 damage from cold-based attacks.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -4 vs cold effects; +4 damage from cold attacks

abilities.name: Keen Senses
abilities.description: Saurians have acute senses, giving them the Alertness Edge.
abilities.mechanical_effect: Alertness Edge (+2 Notice)

abilities.name: Outsider (Minor)
abilities.description: Most species distrust saurians for some reason. Perhaps it is their strange ways and customs, their often-sibilant speech, or an ancient subconscious fear of their reptilian ancestors. Saurians subtract 2 from Persuasion rolls with all but others of their kind.
abilities.mechanical_effect: -2 Persuasion with all but other saurians
